00025 /* Transmit Buffer Pool Definitions */
00026 #define QMTXPOOLSZ      5
00027 #define QMTXBUFSIZE     QMUXSDU_HDR_SZ + QMPARAMMAX
00028 
00029 /* Transmit Small Buffer Pool Definitions */
00030 #define QMTXSMALLPLSZ   20
00031 #define QMTXSMLBUFSIZE  QMUXSDU_HDR_SZ + 256
00032 
00033 /* Timeout guard interval. This value is the basic timeout applied by the API
00034  * side whenever it calls icapi_rcv(). It is added to the application's
00035  * specified timeout on API calls, while the caller's timeout is used directly
00036  * by the SDK when it is awaiting a response from the modem for a QMI response.
00037  * This ensure that the modem timeout will always happen first. If the
00038  * icapi_rcv() times out, then this is some kind of system failure like the SDK
00039  * process has died.
00040  */
00041 #define QMTIMEGUARD         1000
00042 
00043 /* Timeout value to use in QM package when calling icsmt_rcv() */
00044 #define QMNOTIMEOUT         0
00045 
00046 /* QMI Request/Response task Event IDs */
00047 #define QMRESPONSE          1    /* Event ID for QMI Response packet */
00048 
00049 /* Request/Response (RR) Task */
00050 #define QMMRESPTIMEOUT    5000 /* Modem response timeout in ms */
00051 #define QMEVTPOOLSZ       30   /* # of buffers in event pool */
00052 #define QMMSGDEPTH        (QMEVTPOOLSZ + 1) /* QM RR Task msg queue depth */
00053 
00054 /* Logging masks */
00055 #define QMLOG_CLASSA        0x0001
00056 #define QMLOG_CLASSB        0x0002
00057 #define QMLOG_CLASSC        0x0004
00058 
00059 /*************
00060  *
00061  * Name:    qmeventtypes
00062  *
00063  * Purpose: Enumerated list of event block types. These are the types
00064  *          that get written into the QMI Event Block whenever an
00065  *          inter-task message is to be sent to the QM Task.
00066  *
00067  * Members: QM_QMIREQ_EVT   - QMI service request event
00068  *          QM_QMIRSP_EVT   - QMI service response event
00069  *          QM_TMRTICK_EVT  - Timer Tick event
00070  *          QM_APPDEV_EVT
00071  * Notes:   None
00072  *
00073  **************/
00074 enum qmeventtype {
00075     QM_MIN_EVT,
00076     QM_QMIREQ_EVT = QM_MIN_EVT,
00077     QM_QMIRSP_EVT,
00078     QM_TMRTICK_EVT,
00079     QM_DS_DEVICE_EVT,
00080 };
00081 
00082 /*************
00083  *
00084  * Name:    qmevtblock
00085  *
00086  * Purpose: Structure used to pass information into the QMI
00087  *          Request/Response task.
00088  *
00089  * Members: qmeventtype     - Indicates the remaining content of this block
00090  *          qmevtdatap      - Pointer to a buffer containing data to be handled
00091  *                            by the QM RR Task.
00092  *          qmevtmemfreep   - Pointer to the address to use when releasing the
00093  *                            memory containing the data. NULL if nothing needs
00094  *                            to be released.
00095  *          qmevtipcchan    - IPC channel pertaining to a QMI request event
00096  *
00097  * Notes:   None
00098  *
00099  **************/
00100 struct qmevtblock
00101 {
00102     enum qmeventtype qmeventtype;
00103     swi_uint8        *qmevtdatap;
00104     swi_uint8        *qmevtmemfreep;
00105     swi_uint8        qmevtipcchan;
00106     enum qmisupportedclients client;
00107 };
00108 
00109 /*************
00110  *
00111  * Name:    qmwdata
00112  *
00113  * Purpose: Structure to hold key information about the outstanding packet
00114  *          being sent to the modem. When the response is received it must
00115  *          correlate directly with this information.
00116  *
00117  * Members: qmsbusy         - Whether the QM RR task is already waiting
00118  *                            for a QMI response from the modem.
00119  *          qmtimeoutflag   - Indicates whether the thread timed out
00120  *                            waiting for a response from the modem.
00121  *          qmoperation     - The value we expect to see in the operation
00122  *                            type field of the response packet.
00123  *          qmipcchannel    - The IPC channel that the QMI request came through
00124  *
00125  * Notes:
00126  *
00127  **************/
00128 struct qmwdata
00129 {
00130     swi_bool   qmbusy;
00131     swi_bool   qmtimeoutflag;
00132     swi_uint8  qmoperation;
00133     swi_uint8  qmipcchannel;
00134 };
00135 
00136 /*************
00137  *
00138  * Name:    qm_fms_info
00139  *
00140  * Purpose: Information required by the Image Management task for performing
00141  *          firmware upgrades.
00142  *
00143  * Members: path    - fully qualified path to directory containing candidate
00144  *                    firmware image(s).
00145  *
00146  * Notes:   none
00147  *
00148  **************/
00149 struct qm_fms_info{
00150     swi_char path[QM_FMS_IMAGE_PATH_MAX_SZ];
00151     swi_bool fw_download_requested;
00152 };
00153 
00154 /*************
00155  *
00156  * Name:    qmtcb
00157  *
00158  * Purpose: QM RR Task control block structure
00159  *
00160  * Members: qmdlcb      -   DL package control block for logging
00161  *          qmicmsgque      IC SMT Message queue
00162  *          qmevtpool   -   MM pool structure. Contains buffers used
00163  *                          to store information about QMI Reponses.
00164  *                          Groups several arguments that can be referenced
00165  *                          by a single handle
00166  *          qmwdata     -   Structure to hold the information about
00167  *                          the current transaction awaiting a response
00168  *                          from the modem
00169  *          qmictthndl  -   IC package timer handle used by this task to
00170  *                          use the periodic timer tick facility of the IC
00171  *                          package.
00172  *          qmmdmwaittmr -  Downcounting timer used to detect timeouts when
00173  *                          waiting for modem responses. Tick interval is
00174  *                          given by:
00175  *                                  <timeout(ms)>/ICTICKINTERVAL
00176  *          qmtxpool        - qm task request large buffer pool
00177  *          qmtxsmlpool     - qm task request small buffer pool
00178  *          qmdsshell       - qm task ds shell
00179  *          qmideviceready  - qcqmi device ready flag
00180  *          qmappregistered - user application registered with SDK flag
00181  *          fmsdata         - firmware download metadata
00182  *
00183  * Notes:   none
00184  *
00185  **************/
00186 struct qmtcb
00187 {
00188     struct dlusercb     qmdlcb;
00189     struct icsmtcb      qmicmsgque;
00190     struct mmpool       qmevtpool;
00191     struct qmwdata      qmwdata;
00192     struct icttregqblk  qmictthndl;
00193     swi_uint32          qmmdmwaittmr;
00194 
00195     struct mmpool       qmtxpool;
00196     struct mmpool       qmtxsmlpool;
00197 
00198     struct dsipcshell   qmdsshell;
00199     swi_uint8           qmidevicestate;
00200     swi_bool            qmappregistered;
00201     struct qm_fms_info  fms_data;
00202 };
00203 
00204 /*************
00205  *
00206  * Name:    qmgcb
00207  *
00208  * Purpose: QM RR Globl Control Block
00209  *
00210  * Members:
00211  *
00212  * Notes:   none
00213  *
00214  **************/
00215 struct qmgcb
00216 {
00217     struct qmtcb *qmtcbp;
00218     struct dlusercb qmdlcb;
00219     struct qmiclientmanager *pclntmgr;
00220 };
00221 
00222 /*************
00223  *
00224  * Name:    amqmimsgtype
00225  *
00226  * Purpose: QMI message type
00227  *
00228  * Members: eQMIREQ - QMI request
00229  *          eQMIRES - QMI response
00230  *          eQMINOT - QMI notification
00231  *          eQMIINVALID - invalid QMI message type
00232  * Notes:
00233  *
00234  **************/
00235 enum amqmimsgtype{
00236     eQMIREQ,
00237     /* NB: QMI documentation and Firmware do not agree. The doc states that
00238      * Response = 1 and Notification = 2, but they are coded with values of
00239      * 2 and 4, respectively.
00240      */
00241     eQMIRES = 2,
00242     eQMINOT = 4,
00243     eQMIINVALID
00244 };
00245 
00246 /*************
00247  *
00248  * Name:    qmicontrolpoint
00249  *
00250  * Purpose: QMI Service Client record. Contains the necessary fields for matching
00251  *          up a QMI client request with a QMI service response
00252  *
00253  * Members: qmisvcname  - QMI service name
00254  *          svctype     - QMI Service Type for which the client has issued
00255  *                        a request.
00256  *          registered  - QMI client registered with service?
00257  *          notifchan   - Incoming Notification IPC channel
00258  *                        (SDK to APP notifications).
00259  *          xactionid   - Transaction ID of the last issued QMI service request.
00260  *          clientbusy  - awaiting a QMI response from the device
00261  *          msgid       - QMI Message ID of the last issued QMI service request
00262  *
00263  * Notes:
00264  *
00265  **************/
00266 struct qmicontrolpoint{
00267     char        qmisvcname[8];
00268     swi_int16   svctype;
00269     swi_bool    registered;
00270     swi_int32   notifchan;
00271     swi_uint16  xactionid;
00272     swi_bool    clientbusy;
00273     swi_int16   msgid;
00274 };
